welcomePage.title: Welcome to the Workbench
welcomePage.intro: This page will help familiarize you with the Workbench. To get started, read the sections below and click on the related links.
welcomePage.item:
Create Java components To begin Java development, create a Java project. Select the newly created project and choose File > New > Other... . In the left column of the wizard, select Java and double click on Java Package in the right column. Fill in the name of your package and click Finish.
To create a Java class, select the package in the navigator view and click on the "Open the New Wizard" toolbar button (on the far left of the toolbar). This toolbar button provides us with a quick alternative to File > New > Other... . Choose Java Class in the right column of the category Java, and click Next. In the class wizard fill in the name of your class and click Finish to create the class and start editing it.

Perspectives, views and editors A window contains one or more perspectives. A perspective consists of views (e.g. Navigator) and editors for working with your resources.
The shortcut bar at the far left of the window allows you to open new perspectives and move between perspectives that are already open. The perspective you are currently working with is shown in the title of the window and in the shortcut bar as a pushed-in icon.
To open the Java perspective choose Window > Open Perspective > Java.

Configuring your perspectives You can move views and editors around the workbench by dragging their titlebars. You can also add more views to your current perspective by using Window > Show View. To reset the perspective to its original state, choose Window > Reset Perspective.
Once you have arranged your perspective, you can save it using Window > Save Perspective As.... You can customize the views, perspectives and New menu operations that show up for your perspective. To do this choose Window > Customize Perspective... . A view can additionally be converted into a Fast View by dragging it to the shortcut bar (at the far left of the window).

Join a CVS team To join a CVS development team, open the CVS Perspective. Next, specify the location of your CVS repository. To do this choose New > CVS Repository Location... from the Repositories view popup menu. When the location wizard opens, fill in the details of your CVS repository and click Finish.
Learn more To learn more you can browse the Workbench User Guide or the Java Development User Guide.
